title: Bug 6322: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: JDK 1.4 includes obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) etc.
OB: When opening the 'All types' dialog in JDK 1.4, the obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) are shown with the same prominence as regular classes.
EB: They should be displayed with less prominence to distinguish them from regular classes.
SR:
1. Open JDK 1.4.
2. Open the 'All types' dialog.
3. Observe the display of obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) alongside regular classes.
